intro: Aeschynomene pulchella, commonly known as the purplestem aeschynomene, is a flowering plant species native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to violet flowers that are often followed by cylindrical, three-lobed seed pods. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Aeschynomene pulchella is also known for its potential use in forage and as a cover crop in agricultural settings.
